description_preview: If you want to know about the life and activities of this remarkable and talented reciter Abu Bakr Al-Shatri, read more.
biblio_en:
Sheikh Abu Bakr Al Shatri is a famous reciter, he was born in Jeddah (Saudi Arabia) in 1970 /1389, but his great grandparents are Yemenis. He has Yemeni and British nationalities. Currently, he lives in London (United Kingdom).
Sheikh Abu Bakr Al Shatri got his basic education in Jeddah schools then he joined the faculty of economics and business administration to get the master degree in Accounting. His study wasn't isolated from Quran, he memorized it when he was young and he made an audio khatma (recitation of whole Quran) when he was 20.
His passion to learn Quran prevented him from stopping at this point , as he learned from most prominent Quran reciters like sheikh Ayman swed, who is a saurian reciter specialized at the ten recitations (Qira'at). Sheikh Ayman gave sheikh Abu Bakr Al Shatri Hafs-from-Asem ejazah (permission to read and teach Quran).
Sheikh Abu Bakr was imam of many mosques in Jeddah one of them was Alfurqan mosque where he worked for years before leaving to Britain after the decision of the Saudi government which prevented Non-Saudis from imamat.

Sheikh Al Shatri visited many states and led Muslims in Al-salat in great and famous mosques as masjid Al sultan Ahmed in Turkey and Muhammad ibn Abd Alwahab Mosque in Qatar. 
Sheikh Al Shatri established an Islamic center carries his name in London where he lives now; this center is a special place for teaching Quran, Arabic language and Islamic religion besides lectures and seminars. Sheikh Al Shatri manages and supervises this center himself and leads Muslims in Al-salat in London mosques and shares his recitations at his official accounts on social media.
biblio_fr:
Abu Bakr Al Shatri de son nom complet Abu Bakr Ibn mohamed Al Shatriest est un réciteur et imam saoudien. Il est né en 1970 à Jedda.

Ayant grandi à Jedda, Abu Bakr Al Shatri a obtenu une licence dans le saint coran sous l'égide de cheikh 'Aymane Rochdi Suwaid' en 1416 H puis le master de comptabilité en 1420 H.

Abu Bakr Al Shatri a été l'imam de plusieurs mosquées, notamment : Al Rajihi, Said Ibn Jubair (à Kandara), abd Allatif Jamil, Attakwa (Al Rawda), AChouiâibi (Assalama).
Actuellement, il est imam de la mosquée 'Al Furkane' à hay Ennassim (Jedda).

Abu Bakr Al Shatri a participé à de nombreuses conférences islamiques en : Egypte, Afrique du Sud, Kuwait, Bahrain....

Abu Bakr Al Shatri est marié et père de quatre enfants, il est surnommé "Abi Abd Arrahmane".
biblio_ar:
الشيخ أبوبكر الشاطري قاريء شهير للقرءان الكريم، و هو من مواليد مدينة جدة بالمملكة العربية السعودية عام 1389 / 1970 و تعود أصوله إلى مدينة حضرموت باليمن، و هو حاصل على الجنسية اليمنية و البريطانية، و يقيم الشيخ حالياً في مدينة لندن بالمملكة المتحدة.
نشأ الشيخ في مدينة جدة بالسعودية و تلقي تعليمه الأساسي في مدارسها ثم التحق بكلية الاقتصاد و إدارة الأعمال ليحصل على درجة الماجستير في المحاسبة، و لم تكن دراسة الشيخ بمعزل عن حفظ القرءان الكريم و إتقان تلاوته فقد حفظ القرءان صغيراً و أصدر ختمة صوتية كاملة للقرءان و هو في العشرين من عمره.
و لم تتوقف رحلة الشيخ أبوبكر الشاطري مع القرءان عند ذلك، فقد سعى الشيخ للتعلم على يد أبرز مشائخ و قراء القرءان و منهم الشيخ السوري المتخصص في القراءات العشر للقراءن "أيمن سويد" و الذي منح الشيخ الشاطري الإجازة برواية حفص عن عاصم.
الشيخ أبوبكر الشاطري كان إماماً للعديد من المساجد داخل مدينة جدة و أشهرها جامع الفرقان الذي عمل فيه لسنوات قبل أن يغادر الشيخ الشاطري إلى بريطانيا إثر قرار الحكومة السعودية منع الأئمة غيرالسعوديين من الإمامة و الخطابة بالمساجد.
زار الشيخ أبوبكر الشاطري العديد من البلدان حول العالم و صلي بالناس إماماً في أشهر المساجد مثل مسجد السلطان أحمد بتركيا و مسجد محمد بن عبدالوهاب بقطر و غيرها. الشيخ أبوبكر الشاطري الآن مقيم في العاصمة البريطانية لندن حيث أسس مركز إسلامي يحمل اسمه و يتولي إدراته و الإشراف عليه بنفسه لتعليم اللغة العربية و القرءان الكريم و تدريس العقيدة الإسلامية بالإضافة إلى عقد المحاضرات و الندوات، و عادة ما يصلي الشيخ بالناس إماماً داخل مساجد لندن و يبث تلاواته عبر حساباته الرسمية على الشبكات الاجتماعية
biblio_html_en:
Abu Bakr Al-Shatri is a name that resonates deeply within the hearts of many across the Muslim world. Born in 1970 in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, Al-Shatri is known for the unique recitation that captures the essence of the holy text's profound beauty and spirituality.

Abu Bakr Al-Shatri, one of the most revered Quran reciters of our time

His journey into the world of Quran recitation began at a young age, a path often pursued within the context of profound personal faith and devotion. From his early years, Al-Shatri displayed a keen interest in Islamic studies and the Quran, which set the foundation for his future in Quranic recitation. His voice, marked by its clarity and emotional depth, can remarkably convey the Quran's message in a way that touches souls, encouraging reflection and deeper understanding among his listeners.

If you want to listen to MP3 Quran recitations of Al-Shatri you can do it on our website.

Abu Bakr Al Shatri and his heart-soothing voice

Al-Shatri's formal education in the Quranic arts was comprehensive. He diligently studied Islam, listening to famous scholars, and attending lectures, which further gave him knowledge and teachings of the Koran. His talent and desire for knowledge made his performances famous and well-attended.

Al-Shatri: A respect in every verse he recites

Beyond his vocal talents, Abu Bakr Al-Shatri is also respected for his adherence to the rules of Tajweed, the art of Quranic phonetics and pronunciation. His precision and meticulousness in this regard ensure that every syllable and letter is delivered with its due rights, a practice that not only enhances the beauty of his recitation but also serves as a model for students of the Quran worldwide. This commitment to excellence in Tajweed highlights the deep respect Al-Shatri holds for the Quran as the word of God, 

The huge impact of Abu Bakr

Al-Shatri's contribution to the Islamic community cannot be measured solely by his creativity. He serves as an imam and preacher in various mosques in Saudi Arabia. He leads prayers and shares knowledge about the teachings of the Quran. He helps people understand Islamic principles more easily and is always ready to serve the community. By participating in sermons, he allows people to communicate and learn principles through reading. Those who seek spiritual growth and understanding always come to him.

The digital age has allowed Abu Bakr Al-Shatri's recitations to reach a global audience. His voice has become a source of comfort and inspiration for millions worldwide through social media, online platforms, and Quranic apps. Whether one is seeking solace, guidance, or simply the pleasure of listening to the Quran audio beautifully recited, Al-Shatri's free recordings offer a gateway to spiritual enrichment.

Al-Shatri's recitations are not limited to the Muslim community. Despite cultural and religious differences, its influence touches the hearts of people of different faiths. In a world rife with misunderstandings and conflicts, but his works serve as the universal message of the Qur'an of compassion, mercy and human brotherhood.

Abu Bakr Al-Shatri's legacy is devotion, excellence, and service. Through his voice, he has not only preserved the beauty and integrity of Quranic recitation but has also inspired countless individuals to deepen their connection with their faith. His recitations are a bridge to the divine, offering to listen to a moment of peace and contemplation in the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Thanks to the inspiring power and beauty of the Quran, Abu Bakr al-Shatri became a beacon of light in the Islamic world, followed by people of all faiths, despite differences. Despite barriers of language, culture and nationality, his recitations continue to inspire, uplift and unite people around the world. The voice of Al-Shatri will reflect the eternal message of the Quran through the hearts of believers, and remains a cherished source of divine connection and understanding,

The influence of Abu Bakr al-Shatri is not limited to just reading and recitation. He shows people that the more you study the Qur'an, the more you discover inner strength and beauty. Through his works, he encourages listeners to delve deeper into the study of the Koran and understand the culture and traditions of Muslims around the world. Al-Shatri shows by his example that not only beautiful reading affects the perception of listeners, but also how a person feels every syllable and every sentence. He faithfully and selflessly brings the teachings of Islam to the world, and for this his figure occupies a significant place in the Islamic world.
